item.title: Moxi add a quote by Terry Pratchett
item.description: "The intelligence of that creature known as a crowd is the square root of the number of people in it." -- Terry Pratchett

item.title: Moxi add a quote by Terry Pratchett
item.description: "Death: Human beings make life so interesting. Do you know, that in a universe so full of wonders, they have managed to invent boredom." -- Terry Pratchett

item.title: Moxi add a quote by Terry Pratchett
item.description: "Seeing, contrary to popular wisdom, isn't believing. It's where belief stops, because it isn't needed any more." -- Terry Pratchett

item.title: Moxi add a quote by Terry Pratchett
item.description: "Sometimes it's better to light a flamethrower than curse the darkness." -- Terry Pratchett

item.title: Moxi add a quote by Terry Pratchett
Moxi add a quote by Terry Pratchett
item.description: "...inside every old person is a young person wondering what happened." -- Terry Pratchett

item.title: Moxi add a quote by Terry Pratchett
item.description: "He'd been wrong, there was a light at the end of the tunnel, and it was a flamethrower." -- Terry Pratchett

item.title: Moxi add a quote by Terry Pratchett
item.description: "Getting an education was a bit like a communicable sexual disease. It made you unsuitable for a lot of jobs and then you had the urge to pass it on." -- Terry Pratchett

item.title: Moxi add a quote by Terry Pratchett
item.description: "The presence of those seeking the truth is infinitely to be preferred to the presence of those who think they've found it." -- Terry Pratchett

item.title: Moxi add a quote by Terry Pratchett
item.description: "There are, it has been said, two types of people in the world. There are those who, when presented with a glass that is exactly half full, say: this glass is half full. And then there are those who say: this glass is half empty. The world belongs, however, to those who can look at the glass and say: What's up with this glass? Excuse me? Excuse me? This is my glass? I don't think so. My glass was full! And it was a bigger glass! Who's been pinching my beer? And at the other end of the bar the world is full of the other type of person, who has a broken glass, or a glass that has been carelessly knocked over (usually by one of the people calling for a larger glass) or who had no glass at all, because he was at the back of the crowd and had failed to catch the barman's eye. " -- Terry Pratchett

item.title: Moxi add a quote by Terry Pratchett
item.description: "Fantasy is an exercise bicycle for the mind. It might not take you anywhere, but it tones up the muscles that can. Of course, I could be wrong." -- Terry Pratchett

item.title: Moxi add a quote by Terry Pratchett
item.description: "This book was written using 100% recycled words." -- Terry Pratchett

item.title: Moxi add a quote by Terry Pratchett
item.description: "If you trust in yourself. . .and believe in your dreams. . .and follow your star. . . you'll still get beaten by people who spent their time working hard and learning things and weren't so lazy." -- Terry Pratchett

item.title: Moxi add a quote by Terry Pratchett
item.description: "Give a man a fire and he's warm for a day, but set fire to him and he's warm for the rest of his life." -- Terry Pratchett

item.title: Moxi add a quote by Terry Pratchett
item.description: "Stories of imagination tend to upset those without one." -- Terry Pratchett

item.title: Moxi add a quote by Terry Pratchett
item.description: "In ancient times cats were worshipped as gods; they have not forgotten this." -- Terry Pratchett

item.title: Moxi add a quote by Terry Pratchett
item.description: "Why do you go away? So that you can come back. So that you can see the place you came from with new eyes and extra colors. And the people there see you differently, too. Coming back to where you started is not the same as never leaving." -- Terry Pratchett

item.title: Moxi add a quote by Terry Pratchett
item.description: "Wisdom comes from experience. Experience is often a result of lack of wisdom." -- Terry Pratchett

item.title: Moxi add a quote by Terry Pratchett
item.description: "I'll be more enthusiastic about encouraging thinking outside the box when there's evidence of any thinking going on inside it." -- Terry Pratchett

item.title: Moxi add a quote by Terry Pratchett
item.description: "There is a rumour going around that I have found God. I think this is unlikely because I have enough difficulty finding my keys, and there is empirical evidence that they exist." -- Terry Pratchett

item.title: Moxi add a quote by Clive Barker
item.description: "To call you excrement would be an insult to the product of my bowels." -- Clive Barker

item.title: Moxi add a quote by Lemony Snicket
item.description: "A man of my acquaintance once wrote a poem called "The Road Less Traveled", describing a journey he took through the woods along a path most travelers never used. The poet found that the road less traveled was peaceful but quite lonely, and he was probably a bit nervous as he went along, because if anything happened on the road less traveled, the other travelers would be on the road more frequently traveled and so couldn't hear him as he cried for help. Sure enough, that poet is dead." -- Lemony Snicket

item.title: Moxi add a quote by J.R.R. Tolkien
item.description: "Do you wish me a good morning, or mean that it is a good morning whether I want it or not; or that you feel good this morning; or that it is a morning to be good on?" -- J.R.R. Tolkien

item.title: Moxi add a quote by Leopold Stokowski
item.description: "A painter paints pictures on canvas. But musicians paint their pictures on silence." -- Leopold Stokowski
